text: Andrej Marinc (born October 4, 1930) is a Slovenian politician who served as the president of the executive council of the Socialist Republic of Slovenia from November 27, 1972, to April 1978. He was born in Celje, Slovenia, and was a member of the League of Communists of Slovenia. He was preceded by Stane Kavčič and succeeded by Anton Vratuša. == Biography & other information/informations == Andrej Marinc was born on October 4, 1930 in Celje. He graduated from the Faculty of Agriculture in Ljubljana. He became a member of the Communist Party of Yugoslavia in 1947. He has been a socio- political worker since 1960, and held many positions: Secretary of the Municipal Committee of SK Celje Secretary of the Regional Committee of SK Celje President of the District Committee of the Socialist Union of the Working People of Slovenia member of the Executive Committee of the Central Committee of the Union of Communists of Slovenia Secretary of the Secretariat of the Central Committee of Slovenia representative of the Republic in the National Assembly of Slovenia member of the commission of the SKJ Presidency for internal issues and development of social relations member of the Conference of the SK organization in the Yugoslav People's Army member of the Commission of the Central Committee of the Slovenian People's Resistance President of the Executive Council of the National Assembly of the SR of Slovenia from November 27, 1972 to April 1978 Chairman of the Presidency of the Central Committee of the Union of Communists of Slovenia from April 1982 to May 1986 member of the Presidency of the SR of Slovenia from 1986 to 1990 Category:1930 births Category:Living people Category:Slovenian politicians
title: Andrej Marinc
